simplesect.title: Summary
simplesect.para: This plugin provides a dockable tabular list of comments extracted from the text of a file being edited in jEdit. The display shows an icon representing the type of comment, the line where the comment appears and the comment text. You can jump to a comment by double-clicking on the corresponding row of the table. The comment text in the buffer can be highlighted as a user option.
A number of default comment tags are supplied, each with a distinctive icon:

You can change the icons associated with a task type by changing the plugin's settings in the Utilities>Global Options dialog. You can also add your own comment types, using the icons supplied with the plugin or your own custom icons.

simplesect.title: Operation
simplesect.para: Whenever the plugin is activated, it will parse a buffer and display formatted comments when the buffer is first loaded, when it is saved, and when you switch buffers or edit panes within a view window. To jump to the text of a comment in the buffer, double-click on the row containing the comment.

You can change the type of comment (for example, from IDEA to TODO, or from TODO to DONE, by right-clicking on a row contaiing a comment. A popup menu will appear with the text of available comment tags. Clicking on on an item will cause the buffer text to be updated to show the new comment tag. The TaskList display will alos be updated.

The TaskList display is not refreshed with every change made to a buffer. It is updated when a buffer is loaded or saved, and when you switch edit panes or buffers in the view window. As a result, if you have made unsaved changes to a buffer, TaskList may not be able to find or change your comment text. You can reparse a buffer at any time using the Task List>Parse buffer menu item in the Plugins menu (which you can tie to a keyboard shortcut) or by double-clicking on the header row of the TaskList table.

simplesect.title: Settings and Options
simplesect.para: There are two option pane windows available for user settings from the Utilities>Global Options dialog. The General options pane allows you to change the appearance of the TaskList table dksiaply and select highlighting of commented buffer text. The Task Types options pane allows you to add, delete or edit comment tags corresponding to task types.

The tags for default task types, and any types you may add, are represented by regular expressions for which the TaskList plugin searches once it encounters a comment token on a line of buffer text. The content of the comment token will depend on the jEdit edit mode being applied to the buffer. The regular expression is applied to all text on a given line following the matching comment. Two fields are extracted for display when a match occurs: the name of the tag that will be displayed at the beginning of the Description column of the TaskList table, and the text of the comment that will follow the tag name. These two fields correspond to two defined groups in the tag's regular expression.

When using the current beta version, the name of the task type should match the tag name used in regular expression.
